Audio Description: A black and white photo is in the upper portion of this World War Two poster that has a light background. At the center of the photo in the front seat of a car is President Franklin Delano Roosevelt. The photo was taken during the president’s national tour of the defense industry in 1942. Roosevelt is looking at a large sheet of white paper being held by a two-star general leaning from the backseat. The general is wearing a shirtsleeve khaki uniform. Roosevelt is wearing a dark coat and a fedora. Roosevelt is looking intently at the information on the paper through the bottom portion of his bi-focal glasses. Standing to the left of Roosevelt is an officer wearing a combat helmet. Nearby is a naval officer in a dark uniform and a white hat. A police officer has his back turned to Roosevelt. A large man wearing a white shirt, black tie and dark suit stands to the right and behind Roosevelt. In the background is a crowd consisting of civilian and military personnel. Below the photo is a quote Roosevelt's fireside chat of October 12, 1942 entitled "Report on the Home Front". The quote in large black letters reads: “Having seen the quality of the work and of the workers on our production lines - and coupling these first-hand observations with the reports of actual performance of our weapons on the fighting front - I can say to you that we are getting ahead of our enemies in the battle of production.” Underneath the quotation is the signature of Franklin Delano Roosevelt.
Creator: United States. Office of War Information
